sentences: Eleanor Catherine Warren MBE or Eleanor Catherine Rutherford Warren (15 June 1919 â€“ 25 August 2005) was a British cellist and music producer.
Warren was born in London in 1919; her father was William Rutherford Warren.
By the time she left the school as a teenager she had met many important musicians.
In 1936 she started the first phase of her career when Gregor Piatigorsky assisted her in getting her first concert appearance as a cellist.
In 1940, the impresario Harold Holt often included her as a supporting artist to the tenor Richard Tauber, with whom she toured the country.
The quartet ended in the 1950s and she joined a trio until a back injury indicated a change of direction.
She joined the BBC in 1964 and in 1969 she organised a series of broadcasts from a music venue of her own devising.
